question: Which of the following is not an electromagnetic radiation?
explanation:
Electromagnetic waves do not require any material medium, but sound waves is a mechanical wave that require a material medium

question: Calculate the electric field intensity between two plates of potential difference 6.5V when separated by a distance of 35cm.
explanation:
Electric Field Intensity (E) = \(\frac{v}{d}\)

= \(\frac{\text{potential difference}}{\text{distance}}\)

= \(\frac{6.5v}{35cm}\)

= \(\frac{6.5}{35 \times 10^{- 2}}\)

= 18.57NC\(^{-1}\)

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Why do soldiers march disorderly while crossing a bridge?
explanation:
Soldiers march disorderly while crossing a bridge to prevent resonance because when soldiers march in orderly manner across a bridge, they generate a rhythmic oscillation of wave on the bridge and at a certain point, would start oscillation to the same rhythm as that of the marching steps. This oscillation would reach a maximum peak when the bridge can no longer sustain its own strength and hence collapses. So for this reasons, soldier are ordered to march disorderly while crossing a bridge.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: To prevent resonance on the bridge
To set the bridge into resonance
To make the b ridge collapse
To spread their weight evenly on the bridge

question: Calculate the upthrust on an object of volume 50cm3 which is immersed in liquid of density \(10^{3}\) kgm-3 [g = 10ms-2]
explanation:
Upthrust = change in weight

density = \(\frac{\text{mass}}{\text{volume}}\)

Mass of liquid displaced = Density of Liquid × Volume;

= \(10^{3} \times 50 \times 10^{−6}m^{3}\)

= 0.05kg

(Note that the volume of \(50cm^{3}\) was converted to \(m^{3}\) by multiplying by \(10^{6}\)) i.e \(50cm^{3} = 50 \times 10^{−6}m^{3}\)

Since mass displaced = 0.05kg

Upthrust = mg = 0.05 × 10

= 0.5N

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Under what conditions are cathode rays produced in a discharge tube?
explanation:
Cathode rays are produced in a discharge tube under Low pressure and high voltage

question: Calculate the specific latent heat of vaporization of steam of 1.13 x 106J of heat energy is required to convert 15kg of steam to water.
explanation:
Quantity of heat = mass(m) × specific latent heat (L)
Q = mL
L = \(\frac{Q}{m}\)

= \(\frac{1.13 \times 10^{6}}{15}\)

= \(7.53 \times 10^{4}\)Jkg\(^{-1}\)

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A cell of internal resistance 2 π supplies current to a 6 π resistor. The efficiency of the cell is
explanation:
Internal resistance determine the maximum current that can be supplied

Efficiency = \(\frac{r}{R}\) × 100

= \(\frac{2}{6}\) × 100

= 33.3%

question: A block and tackle pulley arrangement has 6 pulleys in which an effort of 50N supports a load of 200N, calculate the efficiency of the machine
explanation:
Efficiency = \(\frac{ma}{V.R}\) x \(\frac{100}{1}\)

V.R = number of pulleys = 6

ma = \(\frac{\text{Load}}{\text{Effort}}\) = \(\frac{200}{50}\) = 4

Effiecieny = \(\frac{4}{6}\) × 100 = 66.67%

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Three 3ω resistance are connected in parallel what is the equivalent resistance?
explanation:
Resistor connected in a parallel have an equivalence given by
\(\frac{1}{\text{Reff}}\) = \(\frac{1}{3}\) + \(\frac{1}{3}\) + \(\frac{1}{3}\)

= \(\frac{1 + 1 + 1}{3}\) = \(\frac{3}{3}\) = 1

Reff = 1ω

There is an explanation video available below.

Air conditioner is used to remove heat and maintain a stable temperature in an occupied space

question: The S.I unit of moment of a force is
explanation:
Moment of a force is the product of a force and the perpendicular distance from the line of action of the force
Moment = force × distance
= N × m
= Nm

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Calculate the height of the image formed by a pinhole camera of length 12cm used to photograph an object 60cm away from the hole and 70cm high
explanation:
Magnification = \(\frac{\text{Length of camera}}{\text{distance of object from pin hole}}\)

m = \(\frac{12}{60}\)

= 0.2

Also magnification m = \(\frac{\text{Height of image}}{\text{Height of object}}\)

∴ Height of image = m × height of object

= 0.2 × 70

= 14cm

There is an explanation video available below.

question: When two objects P and Q are supplied with the same quantity of heat, the temperature change in P is observed to be twice that of Q. The mass of P is half that of Q. The ratio of the specific heat capacity pf P to Q is
explanation:
H = mcθ

HP= HQ, θP= 2θ,

mP= \(\frac{1}{2}\)mQ

∴ HP= mQCPθP, also HQ = mQCQθQ

Since HP= HQ

∴ mPcPθP= mQcPθq

Putting in the conditions

\(\frac{1}{2}\)mQ× cP× 2θQ= mQ× θQ× cQ

∴ cP= cQ

\(\frac{C_p}{C_Q}\)= \(\frac{1}{1}\)

= 1:1

There is an explanation video available below.

question: When the r.m.s value of a source of electricity supply is given as 240v, it means that the peak value of the supply is
explanation:
The relationship between the peak value and r.m.s value of electricity supply is given as

V\(_{r.m.s}\) = \(\frac{V_o}{\sqrt{2}}\)

where Vo= peak voltage

∴ Vo= V\(_{r.m.s}\) × √2

= 240 × √2

= 339.5v

= 340v

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Which of the following operations can be used to convert an alternative current dynamo into a direct current dynamo
explanation:
A d.c generator is one in which its current is allowed to flow in one direction even through it may vary in value an a.c generator can only be made to produce a d.c by replacing the two slip rings with a single split ring or commutator.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: number of turns in the coil is increased
strength of the field magnet is increased
slip rings are replaced with split ring commutator
coil is wound on a soft iron armature

explanation:
For capacitance i n parallel, 2µF and 2µF are in parallel,
their equivalence is 2µF and 2µF = 4µF

The 4µF generated is now in series with the remaining 4µF.

The net capacitance for series connection is

\(\frac{1}{C}\) = \(\frac{1}{4}\) + \(\frac{1}{4}\) = 1 + \(\frac{1}{4}\) = \(\frac{2}{4}\)

C = \(\frac{4}{2}\)

= 2µF

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A man of mass 50kg ascends a flight of stains 5m high in 5 seconds. If acceleration due to gravity is 10ms\(^{-2}\) the power expended is
explanation:
Power is the time rate of doing work

i.e power = \(\frac{\text{energy}}{\text{time}}\)

Since energy = mgH

∴ power = \(\frac{mgH}{t}\)

= \(\frac{50 \times 10 \times 5}{t}\)

= 500W

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A radio station broadcast at a frequency of 600KHZ. If the speed of light in air is 3 × 108ms\(^{−1}\). Calculate the wavelength of the radio wave
explanation:
V = fλ

λ = \(\frac{v}{f}\)

= \(\frac{3 \times 10^8}{600 \times 10^3}\) = 500m

= 5 × 102m

N.B 600KHz Frequency = 600 × 103Hz

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Which of the following is a scalar quantity?
explanation:
Scalar quantity is a quantity with only magnitude, it has no direction
Tension, weight, impulse are vector quantities because they have direction. Mass is the only scalar quantity there

question: Determine the focal length of a thin converging lens if the power is 5.0 dioptres
explanation:
Power of a lens = \(\frac{1}{f}\)

f = focal length

f = \(\frac{1}{p}\)

= \(\frac{1}{5}\)

= 0.2m

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A string of length 5cm is extended by 0.04m when a load of 0.8kg is suspended at the end. How far will it extend if a force of 16N is applied? [g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]
explanation:
From Hoke's Law, F = ke, K = Constant of Force

For he first case, Force = mg,

= 0.8 × 10 = 8N

∴ 8 = k × 0.04

k = \(\frac{8}{0.04}\)

= \(\frac{200N}{m}\)

Since K is constant

For the second case, F = ke

F = 200 × e

∴ e = \(\frac{F}{200}\)

= \(\frac{16}{200}\)

= 0.08m

There is an explanation video available below.

question: How can energy loss be minimized through Eddy-current?
explanation:
Eddy currents are produced by the varying flux cathode, the iron core of an equipment thus reducing efficiency due to power consumption. It can be reduced by laminating the core by breaking up the path of eddy current or by increasing the resistance of the core
Usage of insulated soft iron wire is to reduce hysteresis loss
Usage of low resistance wire (thick wire) is to reduce I2R loss
Usage of thick wire is to reduce leakage heat loss due to leakage of magnetic flux
Thus the correct answer is to use high resistance wire or thin wire

There is an explanation video available below.
options: By using insulated soft iron wires

explanation:
c = 8µF, v = 10v

Energy stored = \(\frac{1}{2}\) cv2

= \(\frac{1}{2}\) × (8 × 10− 6) × 102

= 4 × 10\(^{-4}\)

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A constant force of 5N acts for 5 seconds on a mass of 5kg initially at rest. Calculate the final momentum
explanation:
Impulse = momentum

Impulse = Force (f) × time (t)

Momentum = mass (m) × velocity (v)

∴ Ft = Final momentum - initial momentum

FT = mv - mu

Since it is initially at rest u = 0

∴ 5 × 5 = mv − m(0)

25 = mv

∴ Final momentum = 25kgms\(^{-1}\)

There is an explanation video available below.

question: What is the speed of a body vibrating at 50 cyclic per second
explanation:
1 cycle = 3600 = 2π rad

∴ 50 cycle = 2 π rad × 50 = 100 πrad

∴ = angular speed = 50 cycles per seconds = 100 π rads\(_{−1}\)

question: When two mirrors are placed at an angle of 90º to each other, how many images will be formed when an object is placed in front of the mirrors
explanation:
When two mirror are inclined at an angle θ, the number of images formed, n = \(\frac{360}{\theta}\) − 1

∴ since \(\theta\) = 90o

∴ \(\frac{360}{\theta}\) − 1

= 4 − 1

= 3

There is an explanation video available below.

question: If silicon is doped with phosphorus, what type of semiconductor material will be formed?
explanation:
When silicon is doped with a trivalent atom. A p-type semi-conductor will be formed when silicon is doped with a pentavalent atom such as arsenic, a n-type semi-conductor will be formed
Phosphorous is a pentavalent element, so it will produce a o -type semi-conductor

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Calculate the angle of minimum deviation of a 60º prism of a refractive index 1.5[ \(sin^{-1}\) (0.75) = 49º]
explanation:
For a refractive index () = \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (A + D)}{\sin\frac{1}{2}A}\)

D = angle of minimum deviation

A = refractive angle of the prism

1.5 = \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (60 + D)}{\sin\frac{1}{2} \times 60}\)

1.5 = \(\frac{\sin\frac{1}{2} (60 + D)}{\sin 30}\)

Sin \(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 1.5 * Sin 30

Sin \(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 0.75

\(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = Sin-1 (0.75)

but Sin-1 (0.75) = 49o

\(\frac{1}{2}\) (60 + D) = 49

60 + D = 2 * 49 = 98o

D = 98o - 60o

D = 38o

There is an explanation video available below.

question: What is the cost of running seven 40 W lamps and five 80 W lamps for 12 hours of the electrical energy cost N7.00kWh?
explanation:
Seven 40W lamps = 7 × 40 = 280W

Five 80W lamps = 5 × 80 = 400W

Total power = 280W + 400W

= 680W

= \(\frac{680KW}{1000}\) = 0.68KW

The kilowatt hour = 0.68 KW × 12 hrs

= 8.16 KWh

Cost is N 7 per KWh

So the cost of running them = 8.16KWh × N 7/KWh

= 57.12

There is an explanation video available below.

V = IR from ohms law

I = \(\frac{V}{R}\)

Since the resistance are in parallel

\(\frac{1}{Reff}\) = \(\frac{1}{8}\) + \(\frac{1}{12}\) + \(\frac{1}{6}\)

= \(\frac{2 + 3 + 6}{36}\) = \(\frac{11}{36}\)

Reff = \(\frac{36}{11}\) = 3.27

I = I1+ I2+ I3

= \(\frac{V}{Reff}\)= \(\frac{12}{3.27}\)

= 3.669A

I = 3.7A

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Calculate the time taken for a mango fruit that fall from the tree 20 m to the ground [g = 10 ms<sup>-2</sup>]
explanation:
u = , H = 20, g = 10

From equation of motion under gravity

H = ut ± \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt2, It is falling so g is +ve

H = 0 + \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt2

H = \(\frac{1}{2}\)gt2

2H = gt2

\(\frac{2H}{g}\) = t2

t = \(\frac{\sqrt{2H}}{g}\)

= \(\frac{\sqrt {2 \times 20}}{10}\)

= √4

= 2s

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The velocity ratio of an inclined plane where angle of inclination in θ is
explanation:
Consider an inclined plane shown below, as the effort moves along OB, the load moves is lifted up through a vertical height AB

V.R = \(\frac{\text{distance moved by effort}}{\text{distance moved by load}}\) = \(\frac{OB}{AB}\)

But Sinθ = \(\frac{opp}{hyp}\) = \(\frac{AB}{OB}\)

therefore; = \(\frac{OB}{AB}\) = \(\frac{1}{\sin \theta}\)

question: The volume of a fixed mass of gas is 10cm<sup>3</sup>when its pressure is 400cmHg. Determine the volume of the gas when its pressure is 200cmHg.
explanation:
Using boyle's law

P1V1= P2V2

V2= \(\frac{P_1 V_1}{200}\) = \(\frac{400 \times 10}{200}\)

= 20cm3

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Which of the following representations is correct for an atom X with 28 electrons and 30 neutrons?
explanation:
An atom can be represented thus,

\(^{Z}_{A}X\) where Z = mass number

A = atomic number

A = number of proton = number of electrons in a free state = 28

Z = number of protons + number of neutrons = 28 + 30 = 58

\(^{58}_{28}X\)is the representation

There is an explanation video available below.
